course.title: Portraits of Madness
course.description: Writers and filmmakers have long been fascinated by the artistic challenge of representing madness. What can those portraits tell us about the relationship of illness and identity, the ease of losing touch with rationality, the nature of the mind, and our own relative sanity? We will study Susanna Kaysen's memoir Girl, Interrupted; Patrick McGrath's gothic novel Spider and its film adaptation; and the films Donnie Darko, The Hours, and The Silence of the Lambs.
